raw_text: The patient is complaining from bilateral knee pain since five years. Two years ago, the pain increased. Plane X-ray was done showing advanced osteoarthritis grade 4. Non-steroidal anti-inflammatory was given for around one month with muscle relaxants showing mild improvement. She is now doing physiotherapy exercises to see again after two weeks.
refined_text: The patient has been experiencing bilateral knee pain for five years. The pain worsened two years ago. A plain X-ray revealed advanced grade 4 osteoarthritis. Non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs and muscle relaxants were prescribed for approximately one month, resulting in mild improvement. She is currently undergoing physiotherapy exercises and will be reassessed in two weeks.
translated_text: The patient has been experiencing bilateral knee pain for five years. The pain worsened two years ago. A plain X-ray revealed advanced grade 4 osteoarthritis. Non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs and muscle relaxants were prescribed for approximately one month, resulting in mild improvement. She is currently undergoing physiotherapy exercises and will be reassessed in two weeks.

json_data.history_of_illness: The patient has been experiencing bilateral knee pain for five years. The pain worsened two years ago.
json_data.current_medication: Non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs and muscle relaxants
json_data.imaging_results: A plain X-ray revealed advanced grade 4 osteoarthritis.

reasoning: The patient presents with bilateral knee pain, a chief complaint that has been ongoing for five years and worsened over the past two years. The diagnosis of advanced grade 4 osteoarthritis is supported by the plain X-ray findings, corresponding to ICD-10 code M17.0 for bilateral primary osteoarthritis. The patient was initially treated with non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs and muscle relaxants, which resulted in mild improvement. Currently, the patient is undergoing physiotherapy exercises. The plan is to reassess the patient in two weeks.
